title: Amazon CloudDirectory
description:
Amazon Cloud Directory

Amazon Cloud Directory is a component of the AWS Directory Service that simplifies the development and management of cloud-scale web, mobile, and IoT applications. This guide describes the Cloud Directory operations that you can call programmatically and includes detailed information on data types and errors. For information about AWS Directory Services features, see AWS Directory Service and the AWS Directory Service Administration Guide.

ObjectAttributeList.description: Attributes on the facet you are adding to the object.

ObjectReference.description: A reference to the object you are adding the specified facet to.

SchemaFacet.description: Identifiers for the facet that you are adding to the object.

PublishedSchemaArn.description: Published schema ARN that needs to be copied. For more information, see arns.

AppliedSchemaArn.description: Applied schema ARN associated with the copied schema in the Directory. You can use this ARN to describe the schema information applied on this directory. For more information, see arns.

DirectoryArn.description: ARN associated with the Directory. For more information, see arns.

ChildReference.description: Child object reference to be attached to the object.

LinkName.description: Link name with which the child object is attached to the parent.

ObjectReference.description: Reference that identifies the object to which the policy will be attached.

PolicyReference.description: Reference associated with the policy object.

IndexReference.description: A reference to the index that you are attaching the object to.

TargetReference.description: A reference to the object that you are attaching to the index.

AttachedObjectIdentifier.description: The ObjectIdentifier of the object that was attached to the index.

AttributeKey.description: A unique identifier for an attribute.

FacetName.description: The name of the facet the attribute exists within.

SchemaArn.description: The ARN of the schema that contains the facet and attribute.

AttributeKeyAndValue.description: The combination of an attribute key and an attribute value.

BatchAddFacetToObject.description: Represents the output of a batch add facet to object operation.

ObjectAttributeList.description: The attributes to set on the object.

ObjectReference.description: A reference to the object being mutated.

SchemaFacet.description: Represents the facet being added to the object.

BatchAddFacetToObjectResponse.description: The result of a batch add facet to object operation.

BatchAttachObject.description: Represents the output of an AttachObject operation.

ChildReference.description: Child object reference to be attached to the object.

BatchAttachObjectResponse.description: Represents the output batch AttachObject response operation.

attachedObjectIdentifier.description: The ObjectIdentifier of the object that has been attached.

BatchCreateObject.description: Represents the output of a CreateObject operation.

BatchReferenceName.description: The batch reference name. See Batches for more information.

ObjectAttributeList.description: Attribute map, which contains an attribute ARN as the key and attribute value as the map value.

ParentReference.description: If specified, the parent reference to which this object will be attached.

SchemaFacet.description: List of FacetArns that will be associated with the object. For more information, see arns.

BatchCreateObjectResponse.description: Represents the output of a CreateObject response operation.

BatchDeleteObject.description: Represents the output of a DeleteObject operation.

ObjectReference.description: Reference that identifies the object.

BatchDeleteObjectResponse.description: Represents the output of a DeleteObject response operation.

BatchDetachObject.description: Represents the output of a DetachObject operation.

BatchReferenceName.description: The batch reference name. See Batches for more information.

ParentReference.description: Parent reference from which the object with the specified link name is detached.

BatchDetachObjectResponse.description: Represents the output of a DetachObject response operation.

BatchListObjectAttributes.description: Represents the output of a ListObjectAttributes operation.

FacetFilter.description: Used to filter the list of object attributes associated with a certain facet.

MaxResults.description: Maximum number of items to be retrieved in a single call. This is an approximate number.

ObjectReference.description: Reference of the object whose attributes need to be listed.

BatchListObjectAttributesResponse.description: Represents the output of a ListObjectAttributes response operation.

Attributes.description: Attributes map associated with the object. AttributeArn is the key; attribute value is the value.

BatchListObjectChildren.description: Represents the output of a ListObjectChildren operation.

MaxResults.description: Maximum number of items to be retrieved in a single call. This is an approximate number.

ObjectReference.description: Reference of the object for which child objects are being listed.

BatchListObjectChildrenResponse.description: Represents the output of a ListObjectChildren response operation.

Children.description: Children structure, which is a map with key as the LinkName and ObjectIdentifier as the value.

BatchReadException.description: Batch Read Exception structure, which contains exception type and message.

Message.description: Exception message associated with the failure.

BatchReadOperation.description: Represents the output of a BatchRead operation.

ListObjectAttributes.description: Lists all attributes associated with an object.

ListObjectChildren.description: Returns a paginated list of child objects that are associated with a given object.

BatchReadOperationResponse.description: Represents the output of a BatchRead response operation.

ExceptionResponse.description: Identifies which operation in a batch has failed.

SuccessfulResponse.description: Identifies which operation in a batch has succeeded.

Operations.description: List of operations that are part of the batch.

Responses.description: List of all the responses for each batch read.

BatchReadSuccessfulResponse.description: Represents the output of a BatchRead success response operation.

ListObjectAttributes.description: Lists all attributes associated with an object.

ListObjectChildren.description: Returns a paginated list of child objects associated with a given object.

BatchRemoveFacetFromObject.description: Batch operation to remove a facet from an object.

ObjectReference.description: A reference to the object whose facet will be removed.

SchemaFacet.description: The facet to remove from the object.

BatchUpdateObjectAttributes.description: Represents the output of a BatchUpdate operation.

ObjectReference.description: Reference that identifies the object.

BatchUpdateObjectAttributesResponse.description: Represents the output of a BatchUpdate response operation.

BatchWriteOperation.description: Represents the output of a BatchWrite operation.

AddFacetToObject.description: Batch operation adding a facet to an object.

RemoveFacetFromObject.description: Batch operation removing a facet from an object.

BatchWriteOperationResponse.description: Represents the output of a BatchWrite response operation.

AddFacetToObject.description: Result of an add facet to object batch operation.

RemoveFacetFromObject.description: Result of a batch remove facet from object operation.

Operations.description: List of operations that are part of the batch.

Responses.description: List of all the responses for each batch write.

CannotListParentOfRootException.description: Cannot list the parents of a Directory root.

Name.description: Name of the Directory. Should be unique per account, per region.

AppliedSchemaArn.description: ARN of the published schema in the Directory. Once a published schema is copied into the directory, it has its own ARN which is referred to applied schema ARN. For more information, see arns.

DirectoryArn.description: ARN associated with the Directory. For more information, see arns.

ObjectIdentifier.description: The root object node of the created directory.

Name.description: Name of the Facet, which is unique for a given schema.

ObjectType.description:
Specifies whether a given object created from this facet is of type Node, Leaf Node, Policy or Index.

  • Node: Can have multiple children but one parent.

  • Leaf Node: Cannot have children but can have multiple parents.

  • Policy: Allows you to store a policy document and policy type. For more information, see Policies.

  • Index: Can be created with the Index API.

IsUnique.description: Indicates whether objects with the same indexed attribute value can be added to the index.

LinkName.description: The name of the link between the parent object and the index object.

OrderedIndexedAttributeList.description: Specifies the Attributes that should be indexed on. Currently only a single attribute is supported.

ParentReference.description: A reference to the parent object that contains the index object.

ObjectIdentifier.description: The ObjectIdentifier of the index created by this operation.

LinkName.description: The name of link that is used to attach this object to a parent.

ObjectAttributeList.description: Attribute map whose attribute ARN contains the key and attribute value as the map value.

ParentReference.description: If specified, the parent reference to which this object will be attached.

SchemaFacets.description: List of facet ARNs to be associated with the object. For more information, see arns.

Name.description: Name associated with the schema. This is unique to each account and in each region.

SchemaArn.description: ARN associated with the schema. For more information, see arns.

DirectoryArn.description: The ARN of the deleted directory.

Name.description: The name of the facet to delete.

ObjectReference.description: Reference that identifies the object.

SchemaArn.description: Input ARN that is returned as part of the response. For more information, see arns.

IndexReference.description: A reference to the index object.

TargetReference.description: A reference to the object being detached from the index.

DetachedObjectIdentifier.description: The ObjectIdentifier of the object that was detached from the index.

LinkName.description: Link name associated with the object that needs to be detached.

ParentReference.description: Parent reference from which the object with the specified link name is detached.

DetachedObjectIdentifier.description: The ObjectIdentifier that was detached from the object.

ObjectReference.description: Reference that identifies the object whose policy object will be detached.

PolicyReference.description: Reference that identifies the policy object.

Directory.description: Directory structure that includes the directory name and directory ARN.

CreationDateTime.description: The date and time when the directory was created.

DirectoryArn.description: ARN associated with the directory. For more information, see arns.

State.description: The state of the directory. Can be either Enabled, Disabled, or Deleted.

DirectoryAlreadyExistsException.description: Indicates that a Directory could not be created due to a naming conflict. Choose a different name and try again.

DirectoryDeletedException.description: A directory that has been deleted has been attempted to be accessed. Note: The requested resource will eventually cease to exist.

DirectoryNotDisabledException.description: An operation can only operate on a disabled directory.

DirectoryNotEnabledException.description: An operation can only operate on a directory that is not enabled.

DirectoryArn.description: The ARN of the directory that has been disabled.
The ARN of the enabled directory.

ObjectType.description: Object type associated with the facet. See CreateFacetRequest$ObjectType for more details.

FacetAlreadyExistsException.description: A facet with the same name already exists.

AttributeDefinition.description: A facet attribute consists of either a definition or a reference. This structure contains the attribute definition. See Attribute References for more information.

AttributeReference.description: Attribute reference associated with the attribute. See Attribute References for more information.

Name.description: The name of the facet attribute.

FacetAttributeDefinition.description: A facet attribute definition. See Attribute References for more information.

DefaultValue.description: The default value of the attribute (if configured).

IsImmutable.description: Whether the attribute is mutable or not.

Rules.description: Validation rules attached to the attribute definition.

FacetAttributeReference.description: Facet attribute reference that specifies the attribute definition which contains attribute facet name and attribute name.

TargetAttributeName.description: Target attribute name associated with the facet reference. See Attribute References for more information.

TargetFacetName.description: Target facet name associated with the facet reference. See Attribute References for more information.

FacetAttributeUpdate.description: A structure that contains information used to update an attribute.

Action.description: The action to perform when updating the attribute.

FacetInUseException.description: Occurs when deleting a facet that contains an attribute which is a target to an attribute reference in a different facet.

FacetNotFoundException.description: The specified Facet could not be found.

FacetValidationException.description: The Facet you provided was not well formed or could not be validated with the schema.

Name.description: The name of the facet to retrieve.

ObjectReference.description: A reference to the object.

SchemaFacets.description: The facets attached to the specified object.

Document.description: The JSON representation of the schema document.

Name.description: The name of the retrieved schema.

IndexAttachment.description: Represents an index and an attached object.

ObjectIdentifier.description: The ObjectIdentifier of the object attached to the index.

IndexedAttributeMissingException.description: An object has been attempted to be attached to an object that does not have the appropriate attribute value.

InternalServiceException.description: Indicates a problem that must be resolved by Amazon Web Services. This might be a transient error in which case you can retry your request until it succeeds. Otherwise, go to the AWS Service Health Dashboard site to see if there are any operational issues with the service.

InvalidArnException.description: Indicates that the provided ARN value is not valid.

InvalidAttachmentException.description: Indicates that an attempt to attach an object with the same link name or to apply a schema with same name has occurred. Rename the link or the schema and then try again.

InvalidFacetUpdateException.description: An attempt to modify a Facet resulted in an invalid schema exception.

InvalidNextTokenException.description: Indicates that the NextToken value is not valid.

InvalidRuleException.description: Occurs when any of the rule parameter keys or values are invalid.

InvalidSchemaDocException.description: Indicates that the provided SchemaDoc value is not valid.

InvalidTaggingRequestException.description: Can occur for multiple reasons such as when you tag a resource that doesnâ€™t exist or if you specify a higher number of tags for a resource than the allowed limit. Allowed limit is 50 tags per resource.

LimitExceededException.description: Indicates limits are exceeded. See Limits for more information.

LinkNameAlreadyInUseException.description: Indicates that a link could not be created due to a naming conflict. Choose a different name and then try again.

DirectoryArn.description: The ARN of the directory you are listing.

MaxResults.description: The maximum number of results to retrieve.

SchemaArns.description: The ARNs of schemas that are applied to the directory.

MaxResults.description: The maximum number of results to retrieve.

TargetReference.description: A reference to the object to that has indices attached.

IndexAttachments.description: The indices attached to the specified object.

MaxResults.description: The maximum number of results to retrieve.

SchemaArns.description: The ARNs of retrieved development schemas.

MaxResults.description: The maximum number of results to retrieve.

state.description: The state of the directories in the list. Can be either Enabled, Disabled, or Deleted.

Directories.description: Lists all directories associated with your account in pagination fashion.

MaxResults.description: The maximum number of results to retrieve.

Name.description: The name of the facet whose attributes will be retrieved.

Attributes.description: The attributes attached to the facet.

MaxResults.description: The maximum number of results to retrieve

FacetNames.description: The names of facets that exist within the schema.

IndexReference.description: The reference to the index to list.

MaxResults.description: The maximum number of results to retrieve from the index.

RangesOnIndexedValues.description: Specifies the ranges of indexed values that you want to query.

IndexAttachments.description: The objects and indexed values attached to the index.

FacetFilter.description: Used to filter the list of object attributes associated with a certain facet.

MaxResults.description: Maximum number of items to be retrieved in a single call. This is an approximate number.

ObjectReference.description: Reference that identifies the object whose attributes will be listed.

Attributes.description: Attributes map associated with the object. AttributeArn is the key, and attribute value is the value.

MaxResults.description: Maximum number of items to be retrieved in a single call. This is an approximate number.

ObjectReference.description: Reference that identifies the object for which child objects are being listed.

Children.description: Children structure, which is a map with key as the LinkName and ObjectIdentifier as the value.

MaxResults.description: Maximum number of items to be retrieved in a single call. This is an approximate number.

ObjectReference.description: Reference that identifies the object whose parent paths are listed.

PathToObjectIdentifiersList.description: Returns the path to the ObjectIdentifiers associated with the directory.

MaxResults.description: Maximum number of items to be retrieved in a single call. This is an approximate number.

ObjectReference.description: Reference that identifies the object for which parent objects are being listed.

Parents.description: Parent structure, which is a map with key as the ObjectIdentifier and LinkName as the value.

MaxResults.description: Maximum number of items to be retrieved in a single call. This is an approximate number.

ObjectReference.description: Reference that identifies the object for which policies will be listed.

AttachedPolicyIds.description: List of policy ObjectIdentifiers, that are attached to the object.

MaxResults.description: Maximum number of items to be retrieved in a single call. This is an approximate number.

PolicyReference.description: Reference that identifies the policy object.

ObjectIdentifiers.description: List of ObjectIdentifiers to which the policy is attached.

MaxResults.description: The maximum number of results to retrieve.
The MaxResults parameter sets the maximum number of results returned in a single page. This is for future use and is not supported currently.

NextToken.description: The pagination token. This is for future use. Currently pagination is not supported for tagging.

ResourceArn.description: ARN of the resource. Tagging is only supported for directories.

NextToken.description: The token to use to retrieve the next page of results. This value is null when there are no more results to return.

Tags.description: List of tag key value pairs associated with the response.

MaxResults.description: Maximum number of items to be retrieved in a single call. This is an approximate number.

NextToken.description: The token to request the next page of results.

ObjectReference.description: Reference that identifies the object whose policies will be looked up.

PolicyToPathList.description: Provides list of path to policies. Policies contain PolicyId, ObjectIdentifier, and PolicyType.

NotIndexException.description: Indicates the requested operation can only operate on index objects.

NotNodeException.description: Occurs when any invalid operations are performed on an object which is not a node, such as calling ListObjectChildren for a leaf node object.

NotPolicyException.description: Indicates the requested operation can only operate on policy objects.

ObjectAlreadyDetachedException.description: Indicates the object is not attached to the index.

ObjectAttributeAction.description: The action to take on the object attribute.

ObjectAttributeActionType.description: Type can be either Update or Delete.

ObjectAttributeUpdateValue.description: The value that you want to update to.

AttributeKey.description: The key of the attribute the attribute range covers.

Range.description: The range of attribute values being selected.

ObjectAttributeUpdate.description: Structure that contains attribute update information.

ObjectAttributeAction.description: The action to perform as part of the attribute update.

ObjectAttributeKey.description: The key of the attribute being updated.

ObjectNotDetachedException.description: Indicates the requested operation cannot be completed because the object has not been detached from the tree.

ObjectReference.description: Reference that identifies an object.

Selector.description:
Allows you to specify an object. You can identify an object in one of the following ways:

  • $ObjectIdentifier - Identifies the object by ObjectIdentifier

  • /some/path - Identifies the object based on path

  • #SomeBatchReference - Identifies the object in a batch call

PathToObjectIdentifiers.description: Returns the path to the ObjectIdentifiers associated with the directory.

ObjectIdentifiers.description: Lists ObjectIdentifiers starting from directory root to the object in the request.

Path.description: The path used to identify the object starting from directory root.

PolicyAttachment.description: Contains the PolicyType, PolicyId, and the ObjectIdentifier to which it is attached.

PolicyType.description: The type of policy that can be associated with PolicyAttachment.

PolicyToPath.description: Used when a regular object exists in a Directory and you want to find all of the policies associated with that object and the parent to that object.

Path.description: The path that is referenced from the root.

Name.description: New name under which the schema will be published. If this is not provided, the development schema is considered.

Version.description: Version under which the schema will be published.

PublishedSchemaArn.description: ARN associated with the published schema. For more information, see arns.

Arn.description: The ARN of the schema to update.

ObjectReference.description: A reference to the object to remove the facet from.

ResourceNotFoundException.description: The specified resource could not be found.

RetryableConflictException.description: Occurs when a conflict with a previous successful write is detected. For example, if a write operation occurs on an object and then an attempt is made to read the object using â€œSERIALIZABLEâ€ consistency, this exception may result. This generally occurs when the previous write did not have time to propagate to the host serving the current request. A retry (with appropriate backoff logic) is the recommended response to this exception.

Rule.description: Contains an ARN and parameters associated with the rule.

Parameters.description: Min and max parameters associated with the rule.

Type.description: The type of attribute validation rule.

SchemaAlreadyExistsException.description: Indicates that a schema could not be created due to a naming conflict. Please select a different name and then try again.

SchemaAlreadyPublishedException.description: Indicates a schema is already published.

SchemaArn.description: The ARN of the schema that contains the facet.

StillContainsLinksException.description: The object could not be deleted because links still exist. Remove the links and then try the operation again.

Tag.description: Tag structure which contains tag key and value.

ResourceArn.description: ARN of the resource. Tagging is only supported for directories.

Tags.description: List of tag key value pairs.

TypedAttributeValue.description: Represents the data for a typed attribute. You can set one, and only one, of the elements. Each attribute in an item is a name-value pair. Attributes have a single value.

EndValue.description: The attribute value to terminate the range at.

StartValue.description: The value to start the range at.

UnsupportedIndexTypeException.description: Indicates the requested index type is not supported.

ResourceArn.description: ARN of the resource. Tagging is only supported for directories.

TagKeys.description: Keys of the tag that needs to be removed from the resource.

AttributeUpdates.description: List of attributes that need to be updated in a given schema Facet. Each attribute is followed by AttributeAction, which specifies the type of update operation to perform.

ObjectType.description: Object type associated with the facet. See CreateFacetRequest$ObjectType for more details.

ObjectReference.description: Reference that identifies the object.

SchemaArn.description: ARN associated with the updated schema. For more information, see arns.

ValidationException.description: Indicates your request is malformed in some manner. See the exception message.

actions.title: BatchRead
actions.description: Performs all the read operations in a batch.

actions.title: BatchWrite
actions.description: Performs all the write operations in a batch. Either all the operations succeed or none. Batch writes supports only object-related operations.

actions.title: DeleteDirectory
actions.description: Deletes a directory. Only disabled directories can be deleted. A deleted directory cannot be undone. Exercise extreme caution when deleting directories.

actions.title: CreateDirectory
actions.description: Creates a Directory by copying the published schema into the directory. A directory cannot be created without a schema.

actions.title: DisableDirectory
actions.description: Disables the specified directory. Disabled directories cannot be read or written to. Only enabled directories can be disabled. Disabled directories may be reenabled.

actions.title: EnableDirectory
actions.description: Enables the specified directory. Only disabled directories can be enabled. Once enabled, the directory can then be read and written to.

actions.title: GetDirectory
actions.description: Retrieves metadata about a directory.

actions.title: ListDirectories
actions.description: Lists directories created within an account.

MaxResults.description: Pagination limit

actions.title: UpdateFacet
actions.description:
Does the following:

  1. Adds new Attributes, Rules, or ObjectTypes.

  2. Updates existing Attributes, Rules, or ObjectTypes.

  3. Deletes existing Attributes, Rules, or ObjectTypes.

actions.title: ListFacetAttributes
actions.description: Retrieves attributes attached to the facet.

MaxResults.description: Pagination limit

actions.title: CreateFacet
actions.description: Creates a new Facet in a schema. Facet creation is allowed only in development or applied schemas.

actions.title: DeleteFacet
actions.description: Deletes a given Facet. All attributes and Rules associated with the facet will be deleted. Only development schema facets are allowed deletion.

actions.title: ListFacetNames
actions.description: Retrieves the names of facets that exist in a schema.

MaxResults.description: Pagination limit

actions.title: CreateIndex
actions.description: Creates an index object. See Indexing for more information.

actions.title: AttachToIndex
actions.description: Attaches the specified object to the specified index.

actions.title: DetachFromIndex
actions.description: Detaches the specified object from the specified index.

actions.title: ListIndex
actions.description: Lists objects attached to the specified index.

MaxResults.description: Pagination limit

actions.title: CreateObject
actions.description: Creates an object in a Directory. Additionally attaches the object to a parent, if a parent reference and LinkName is specified. An object is simply a collection of Facet attributes. You can also use this API call to create a policy object, if the facet from which you create the object is a policy facet.

actions.title: AttachObject
actions.description:
Attaches an existing object to another object. An object can be accessed in two ways:

  1. Using the path

  2. Using ObjectIdentifier

actions.title: ListObjectAttributes
actions.description: Lists all attributes associated with an object.

MaxResults.description: Pagination limit

actions.title: ListObjectChildren
actions.description: Returns a paginated list of child objects associated with a given object.

MaxResults.description: Pagination limit

actions.title: DeleteObject
actions.description: Deletes an object and its associated attributes. Only objects with no children and no parents can be deleted.

actions.title: DetachObject
actions.description: Detaches a given object from the parent object. The object that is to be detached from the parent is specified by the link name.

actions.title: AddFacetToObject
actions.description: Adds a new Facet to an object.

actions.title: RemoveFacetFromObject
actions.description: Removes the specified facet from the specified object.

actions.title: ListAttachedIndices
actions.description: Lists indices attached to an object.

MaxResults.description: Pagination limit

actions.title: GetObjectInformation
actions.description: Retrieves metadata about an object.

actions.title: ListObjectParents
actions.description: Lists parent objects associated with a given object in pagination fashion.

MaxResults.description: Pagination limit

actions.title: ListObjectParentPaths
actions.description:
Retrieves all available parent paths for any object type such as node, leaf node, policy node, and index node objects. For more information about objects, see Directory Structure.

Use this API to evaluate all parents for an object. The call returns all objects from the root of the directory up to the requested object. The API returns the number of paths based on user-defined MaxResults, in case there are multiple paths to the parent. The order of the paths and nodes returned is consistent among multiple API calls unless the objects are deleted or moved. Paths not leading to directory root are ignored from the target object.

MaxResults.description: Pagination limit

actions.title: ListObjectPolicies
actions.description: Returns policies attached to an object in pagination fashion.

MaxResults.description: Pagination limit

actions.title: UpdateObjectAttributes
actions.description: Updates a given object's attributes.

actions.title: AttachPolicy
actions.description: Attaches a policy object to a regular object. An object can have a limited number of attached policies.

actions.title: ListPolicyAttachments
actions.description: Returns all of the ObjectIdentifiers to which a given policy is attached.

MaxResults.description: Pagination limit

actions.title: DetachPolicy
actions.description: Detaches a policy from an object.

actions.title: LookupPolicy
actions.description: Lists all policies from the root of the Directory to the object specified. If there are no policies present, an empty list is returned. If policies are present, and if some objects don't have the policies attached, it returns the ObjectIdentifier for such objects. If policies are present, it returns ObjectIdentifier, policyId, and policyType. Paths that don't lead to the root from the target object are ignored.

MaxResults.description: Pagination limit

actions.title: DeleteSchema
actions.description: Deletes a given schema. Schemas in a development and published state can only be deleted.

actions.title: ListAppliedSchemaArns
actions.description: Lists schemas applied to a directory.

MaxResults.description: Pagination limit

actions.title: ApplySchema
actions.description: Copies input published schema into Directory with same name and version as that of published schema .

actions.title: CreateSchema
actions.description:
Creates a new schema in a development state. A schema can exist in three phases:

  • Development: This is a mutable phase of the schema. All new schemas are in the development phase. Once the schema is finalized, it can be published.

  • Published: Published schemas are immutable and have a version associated with them.

  • Applied: Applied schemas are mutable in a way that allows you to add new schema facets. You can also add new, nonrequired attributes to existing schema facets. You can apply only published schemas to directories.

actions.title: ListDevelopmentSchemaArns
actions.description: Retrieves the ARNs of schemas in the development state.

MaxResults.description: Pagination limit

actions.title: PutSchemaFromJson
actions.description: Allows a schema to be updated using JSON upload. Only available for development schemas. See JSON Schema Format for more information.

actions.title: PublishSchema
actions.description: Publishes a development schema with a version. If description and attributes are specified, PublishSchema overrides the development schema description and attributes. If not, the development schema description and attributes are used.

actions.title: ListPublishedSchemaArns
actions.description: Retrieves published schema ARNs.

MaxResults.description: Pagination limit

actions.title: UpdateSchema
actions.description: Updates the schema name with a new name. Only development schema names can be updated.

actions.title: ListTagsForResource
actions.description: Returns tags for a resource. Tagging is currently supported only for directories with a limit of 50 tags per directory. All 50 tags are returned for a given directory with this API call.

MaxResults.description: Pagination limit

actions.title: TagResource
actions.description: API for adding tags to a resource.

actions.title: UntagResource
actions.description: API for removing tags from a resource.
